title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
A cryptographic flaw in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9 and Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2 resulted in storage of sensitive information with an algorithm that is insufficiently resistant to brute force attacks.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7858
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051916/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-23
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7h8v-f2g9-39fx
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Cryptographic Flaw

items.content_html:
Insufficient server-side validation of user input could allow an attacker to bypass file upload restrictions in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7861
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j837-vm6w-6qcv
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Unsafe File Upload

items.content_html:
Insufficient server-side validation of user input could allow an attacker to bypass file upload restrictions in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2.

items.content_html:
An insecure direct object reference (IDOR) vulnerability in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2 can lead to unauthorized disclosure of company credit history details.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7854
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051916/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-23
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hpxv-vpfv-7jc9
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition IDOR Vulnerability

items.content_html:
An insecure direct object reference (IDOR) vulnerability in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2 can lead to unauthorized disclosure of company credit history details.

items.content_html:
A cryptograhic flaw in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2 could be abused by an unauthenticated user to discover an invariant used in gift card generation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7855
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051916/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-23
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2w26-gmqm-mc5p

items.content_html:
A cryptograhic flaw in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2 could be abused by an unauthenticated user to discover an invariant used in gift card generation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7855
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051916/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-23
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2w26-gmqm-mc5p

items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Cryptographic Flaw

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. This could be exploited by an authenticated user with privileges to the tax notifications configuration in the Magento admin panel.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7853
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220127030535/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-24
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mjgf-xmrr-6gvx
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. This could be exploited by an authenticated user with privileges to the tax notifications configuration in the Magento admin panel.

items.content_html:
A path disclosure vulnerability exists in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. Requests for a specific file path could result in a redirect to the URL of the Magento admin panel, disclosing its location to potentially unauthorized parties.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7852
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121011306/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-33
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xcgp-c6hp-cj4r
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Path Disclosure

items.content_html:
A path disclosure vulnerability exists in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. Requests for a specific file path could result in a redirect to the URL of the Magento admin panel, disclosing its location to potentially unauthorized parties.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7852
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121011306/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-33
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xcgp-c6hp-cj4r

items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Path Disclosure

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the admin panel of Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. This could be exploited by an authenticated user with privileges to customer configurations to inject malicious javascript.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7897
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jxp3-mmw7-8285
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the admin panel of Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. This could be exploited by an authenticated user with privileges to customer configurations to inject malicious javascript.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7897
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jxp3-mmw7-8285
